title: Opinion: America's Housing Crisis Requires Bold Government Intervention
introText: Decades of restrictive zoning, NIMBYism, and underinvestment have created a housing affordability crisis that threatens the American Dream. Only bold government actionâ€”at all levelsâ€”can restore the possibility of homeownership for working families.

content.content: The median home now costs 7 times the median incomeâ€”historically, this ratio was 3. Young families are locked out of homeownership, while rents consume ever-larger shares of household budgets.
Restrictive zoning prevents housing construction where it's needed most. NIMBYism blocks affordable housing in wealthy neighborhoods. Federal housing investment has been neglected for decades.

Federal incentives for zoning reform, massive public housing investment, and tenant protections can restore housing affordability. The political will to challenge homeowner interests is the missing ingredient.

summary: America's housing crisis needs bold government action on zoning, investment, and tenant protections.
